benchmark_details.name: MATH-TUTOR BENCH
benchmark_details.overview: MATH-TUTOR BENCH is an open-source benchmark designed for holistic evaluation of dialog tutoring models for math tutoring, providing datasets and metrics to assess pedagogical capabilities.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating dialog tutoring models in terms of their pedagogical abilities in math tutoring.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Our work focuses on high school math tutoring and does not evaluate long conversations or dimensions related to safety.

data.source: Consists of datasets like Bridge and MathDial, focusing on real teacher-student tutoring conversations.
data.annotation: Manually annotated by experts and derived from real teacher-student interactions.

methods: Metrics for evaluating problem-solving and pedagogical responses
Reward model for scoring tutoring responses
methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the alignment of model responses with expert teacher responses and calibrated through pairwise comparisons.
methodology.interpretation: Models are assessed on their ability to scaffold student learning and achieve desired pedagogical outcomes.
methodology.baseline_results: Results are provided for various models evaluated against the benchmark tasks.
methodology.validation: The benchmark was validated using data collected from real teacher interactions and tested against human-generated responses.

targeted_risks.harm: The benchmark aims to prevent suboptimal tutoring behavior and mitigate risks from using AI in educational contexts.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All data collected is anonymized, with the intent of protecting user privacy.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The dataset is released under the CC-BY-4.0 license.
